definitions.text: the temporal end; the concluding time
examples: the stopping point of each round was signaled by a bell
the market was up at the finish
they were playing better at the close of the season

definitions.text: the last or lowest in an ordering or series
examples: he was the last to leave
he finished an inglorious last

definitions.text: a person's dying act; the final thing a person can do
examples: he breathed his last

definitions.text: the time at which life ends; continuing until dead
examples: she stayed until his death
a struggle to the last

definitions.text: a unit of weight equal to 4,000 pounds
a unit of capacity for grain equal to 80 bushels
the concluding parts of an event or occurrence
examples: the end was exciting
I had to miss the last of the movie

definitions.text: holding device shaped like a human foot that is used to fashion or repair shoes
persist for a specified period of time
examples: The bad weather lasted for three days

definitions.text: continue to live through hardship or adversity
examples: We went without water and food for 3 days
These superstitions survive in the backwaters of America
The race car driver lived through several very serious accidents
how long can a person last without food and water?

definitions.text: immediately past
examples: last Thursday
the last chapter we read

definitions.text: coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining
examples: the last time I saw Paris
the last day of the month
had the last word
waited until the last minute
he raised his voice in a last supreme call
the last game of the season
down to his last nickel

definitions.text: occurring at or forming an end or termination
examples: his concluding words came as a surprise
the final chapter
the last days of the dinosaurs
terminal leave

definitions.text: most unlikely or unsuitable
examples: the last person we would have suspected
the last man they would have chosen for the job

definitions.text: occurring at the time of death
examples: his last words
the last rites

definitions.text: conclusive in a process or progression
examples: the final answer
a last resort
the net result

definitions.text: highest in extent or degree
examples: to the last measure of human endurance
whether they were accomplices in the last degree or a lesser one was...to be determined individually

definitions.text: not to be altered or undone
examples: the judge's decision is final
the arbiter will have the last say

definitions.text: lowest in rank or importance
examples: last prize
in last place

definitions.text: most_recently
examples: I saw him last in London

definitions.text: the item at the end
examples: last, I'll discuss family values
